title: Graphic Design
description: The Basic Principles of Graphic Design

body.raw:
Graphic design is more than just aesthetics; it’s about creating visuals that communicate messages effectively. Whether you’re designing a logo, website, or marketing material, understanding the basic principles of graphic design is essential to create compelling designs.

## Alignment

Alignment is about making sure that elements are aligned properly and consistently. This means that all of your logo’s elements should align with each other and be in the same plane as the logo.

Alignment is one of the most important factors in creating a good design. When content is aligned, it creates a sense of unity and order, which makes it easier for people to scan through your designs and understand what they’re looking at.

## Visual Hierarchy

You know that feeling when you open a website and see a jumble of text and images? That’s visual chaos. To create visual order, use your design to establish a hierarchy of elements.

Visual hierarchy is the way your website or application uses contrast, size, color, and other factors to give some elements more important than others. You can create a visual hierarchy with color, size, placement (or position), weight, proximity, grouping, and more.

## Contrast

Contrast is another key principle of design that helps set apart important elements from the rest of the page. It allows users to focus on what matters most without being distracted by other things around it — which is especially important on mobile devices where screens are smaller than desktop monitors and less capable of generating lots of contrast on their own. Contrast also helps guide users through a page by providing visual cues about where they might want to go next (ex: call to action, hyperlinks, likewise).

## Repetition

Repetition is an element of design that occurs when multiple elements have the same characteristics when compared with each other. It is an easy way to create consistency across a design and can help establish order within a project. To use repetition effectively, make sure you don’t overdo it by varying factors such as size, color, or placement — otherwise, it will seem like you didn’t put much thought into it!

## Proximity

Proximity refers to how close together or far apart different objects are placed within the same space — and this has an effect on how people perceive those objects: they’re likely to see them as being more related if they’re closer together than if they’re farther apart. This makes proximity an important tool for designers because we want people looking at our designs to see connections between different parts of them.

## Balance

Balance is the key to making a design look good. It’s what allows you to create visual interest, and it’s the reason why some designs feel off.

To create balance, you have to find a way to balance the elements in your design. The best way to do this is by using negative space (white space) and by making sure your elements are visually similar in size and weight. For example, if you have a large image that takes up much of the page, then make sure that there are at least two other elements on the page that are smaller than it. If all of your elements are large, then people won’t know where to focus their attention because they’ll be spread out across different sizes and weights of objects.

## Color

The color palette that you choose for your interiors will have a direct impact on how good your room looks. Therefore, it is important that you choose the right colors for yourself so that the overall look is harmonious and pleasing to the eye. You can use pastel colors for bedrooms whereas bold hues are best suited for kitchens and dining rooms. Likewise, neutral colors like white and cream are best suited for living areas and hallways whereas vibrant shades like orange, red or green work well with bold patterns such as floral prints or geometric prints on rugs, curtains, or upholstery fabrics in bathrooms and dining rooms.

Contrasting colors are often used to create balance in a design. While dark colors recede from view and light colors come forward, there are times when both dark and light colors need to be used together. By pairing them carefully, you can create a balanced look.

## Spacing/Negative Space

Spacing is another one of those things that makes a big difference in how your design looks, but it’s also one of the hardest things to get right. The key thing here is negative space — white space between elements — which helps draw attention to certain parts of your design while making others recede into the background.

## Emphasis

Setting aside the fact that a color is a powerful tool for communicating messages, it should also be used to emphasize important elements of a design. This is why you see so many websites using red and white on their home pages to convey the feeling of urgency. The best part about this technique is that it’s not just a trick — it works!

## Proportion

    Proportion is one of the most important principles in art and design because it affects every other aspect of your work. If your designs have poor proportions, they will look unbalanced and unnatural. On the other hand, if your designs have good proportions, they will look balanced and natural (even if they’re abstract).

## Rhythm

    Rhythm is a pattern of repetition or variation in any kind of art form. Rhythm is characterized by a regular recurrence or pattern in time. It can be found in all forms of life, from music to poetry, from painting to architecture. In art and design, rhythm is created by varying the length, width or shape of elements in your composition.

## Pattern

    Patterns are repeating visual elements used to create order and unity within a composition. Patterns can be used as an element on their own or as an accent within another pattern. In general usage, a pattern is repeated at regular intervals throughout an area or surface for decorative effect. There are many types of patterns: stripes, checks, circles, and dots are just some examples!

## Movement

    We all know what movement means — it’s when something changes position over time! But how do you represent movement in your designs? When designing websites or mobile apps. Movement is created when a viewer sees elements moving around in composition (or across multiple compositions). Movement can be created by overlapping shapes or stacking elements on top of one another (like overlapping apples).

## Variety

    The number one rule of design is variety — you want to give people options so they can find something they like or will use. Variety helps people get what they need from your design in the way they want it — no more scrolling through pages of choices trying to find one item that fits all of their needs! If you only have one option available, then they’ll have to adapt themselves to fit into that one option rather than getting what they need out of it.

## Unity

    Unity means using similar elements in one design so that all the content makes sense together. For example, if all your text is blue with white backgrounds then a visitor will know where to look first when they enter your site because they’re already familiar with those colors and fonts from other areas of your site. If you change the font color to red or yellow then it will disrupt the unity because they don’t know where to look first anymore!

## Line

    The line is another important element used in creating a design because it creates depth and allows viewers to see how things are related spatially. Lines can be straight or curved, thick or thin, but they must all be consistent throughout your project so that viewers can easily read them from a distance or close up without having to focus on them too closely.

As an example, when you look at a painting or drawing, you can see how the artist used lines to create depth and perspective in his work. The artist will start by drawing one line going from left to right and then continue by adding more lines until he achieves the desired effect of depth and perspective within his work of art.

## Shapes

    A shape is any closed area on a flat surface that encloses an area and has a boundary formed by straight lines (circles are closed areas). Shapes are built from lines, curves, and angles. They have volume and weight even though they do not have mass like solid objects do; this makes them ideal for representing objects in art because they can be easily manipulated without changing their appearance too much (e.g., you can make them smaller or larger without affecting their shape).

## Conclusion

Understanding and applying these basic principles of graphic design is crucial for creating visually appealing and effective designs. Whether you’re a beginner or an experienced designer, these principles serve as the foundation for all great design work.

When content is aligned, it creates a sense of unity and order, which makes it easier for people to scan through your designs and understand what they\u2019re looking at."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:13,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.h2,{id:"visual-hierarchy",children:[(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#visual-hierarchy",children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this),"Visual Hierarchy"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:15,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"You know that feeling when you open a website and see a jumble of text and images? That\u2019s visual chaos. To create visual order, use your design to establish a hierarchy of elements."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:17,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Visual hierarchy is the way your website or application uses contrast, size, color, and other factors to give some elements more important than others. You can create a visual hierarchy with color, size, placement (or position), weight, proximity, grouping, and more."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:19,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.h2,{id:"contrast",children:[(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#contrast",children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this),"Contrast"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:21,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Contrast is another key principle of design that helps set apart important elements from the rest of the page. It allows users to focus on what matters most without being distracted by other things around it \u2014 which is especially important on mobile devices where screens are smaller than desktop monitors and less capable of generating lots of contrast on their own. Contrast also helps guide users through a page by providing visual cues about where they might want to go next (ex: call to action, hyperlinks, likewise)."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:23,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.h2,{id:"repetition",children:[(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#repetition",children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this),"Repetition"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:25,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Repetition is an element of design that occurs when multiple elements have the same characteristics when compared with each other. It is an easy way to create consistency across a design and can help establish order within a project. To use repetition effectively, make sure you don\u2019t overdo it by varying factors such as size, color, or placement \u2014 otherwise, it will seem like you didn\u2019t put much thought into it!"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:27,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.h2,{id:"proximity",children:[(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#proximity",children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this),"Proximity"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:29,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Proximity refers to how close together or far apart different objects are placed within the same space \u2014 and this has an effect on how people perceive those objects: they\u2019re likely to see them as being more related if they\u2019re closer together than if they\u2019re farther apart. This makes proximity an important tool for designers because we want people looking at our designs to see connections between different parts of them."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:31,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.h2,{id:"balance",children:[(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#balance",children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this),"Balance"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:33,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Balance is the key to making a design look good. It\u2019s what allows you to create visual interest, and it\u2019s the reason why some designs feel off."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:35,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"To create balance, you have to find a way to balance the elements in your design. The best way to do this is by using negative space (white space) and by making sure your elements are visually similar in size and weight. For example, if you have a large image that takes up much of the page, then make sure that there are at least two other elements on the page that are smaller than it. If all of your elements are large, then people won\u2019t know where to focus their attention because they\u2019ll be spread out across different sizes and weights of objects."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:37,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.h2,{id:"color",children:[(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#color",children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this),"Color"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:39,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"The color palette that you choose for your interiors will have a direct impact on how good your room looks. Therefore, it is important that you choose the right colors for yourself so that the overall look is harmonious and pleasing to the eye. You can use pastel colors for bedrooms whereas bold hues are best suited for kitchens and dining rooms. Likewise, neutral colors like white and cream are best suited for living areas and hallways whereas vibrant shades like orange, red or green work well with bold patterns such as floral prints or geometric prints on rugs, curtains, or upholstery fabrics in bathrooms and dining rooms."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:41,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Contrasting colors are often used to create balance in a design. While dark colors recede from view and light colors come forward, there are times when both dark and light colors need to be used together. By pairing them carefully, you can create a balanced look."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:43,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.h2,{id:"spacingnegative-space",children:[(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#spacingnegative-space",children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this),"Spacing/Negative Space"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:45,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Spacing is another one of those things that makes a big difference in how your design looks, but it\u2019s also one of the hardest things to get right. The key thing here is negative space \u2014 white space between elements \u2014 which helps draw attention to certain parts of your design while making others recede into the background."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:47,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.h2,{id:"emphasis",children:[(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#emphasis",children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this),"Emphasis"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:49,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Setting aside the fact that a color is a powerful tool for communicating messages, it should also be used to emphasize important elements of a design. This is why you see so many websites using red and white on their home pages to convey the feeling of urgency. The best part about this technique is that it\u2019s not just a trick \u2014 it works!"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:51,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.h2,{id:"proportion",children:[(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#proportion",children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this),"Proportion"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:53,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Proportion is one of the most important principles in art and design because it affects every other aspect of your work. If your designs have poor proportions, they will look unbalanced and unnatural. On the other hand, if your designs have good proportions, they will look balanced and natural (even if they\u2019re abstract)."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:55,columnNumber:5},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.h2,{id:"rhythm",children:[(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#rhythm",children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this),"Rhythm"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:57,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Rhythm is a pattern of repetition or variation in any kind of art form. Rhythm is characterized by a regular recurrence or pattern in time. It can be found in all forms of life, from music to poetry, from painting to architecture. In art and design, rhythm is created by varying the length, width or shape of elements in your composition."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:59,columnNumber:5},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.h2,{id:"pattern",children:[(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#pattern",children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this),"Pattern"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:61,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Patterns are repeating visual elements used to create order and unity within a composition. Patterns can be used as an element on their own or as an accent within another pattern. In general usage, a pattern is repeated at regular intervals throughout an area or surface for decorative effect. There are many types of patterns: stripes, checks, circles, and dots are just some examples!"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:63,columnNumber:5},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.h2,{id:"movement",children:[(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#movement",children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this),"Movement"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:65,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"We all know what movement means \u2014 it\u2019s when something changes position over time! But how do you represent movement in your designs? When designing websites or mobile apps. Movement is created when a viewer sees elements moving around in composition (or across multiple compositions). Movement can be created by overlapping shapes or stacking elements on top of one another (like overlapping apples)."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:67,columnNumber:5},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.h2,{id:"variety",children:[(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#variety",children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this),"Variety"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:69,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"The number one rule of design is variety \u2014 you want to give people options so they can find something they like or will use. Variety helps people get what they need from your design in the way they want it \u2014 no more scrolling through pages of choices trying to find one item that fits all of their needs! If you only have one option available, then they\u2019ll have to adapt themselves to fit into that one option rather than getting what they need out of it."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:71,columnNumber:5},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.h2,{id:"unity",children:[(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#unity",children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this),"Unity"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:73,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Unity means using similar elements in one design so that all the content makes sense together. For example, if all your text is blue with white backgrounds then a visitor will know where to look first when they enter your site because they\u2019re already familiar with those colors and fonts from other areas of your site. If you change the font color to red or yellow then it will disrupt the unity because they don\u2019t know where to look first anymore!"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:75,columnNumber:5},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.h2,{id:"line",children:[(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#line",children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx"},this),"Line"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:77,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"The line is another important element used in creating a design because it creates depth and allows viewers to see how things are related spatially. Lines can be straight or curved, thick or thin, but they must all be consistent throughout your project so that viewers can easily read them from a distance or close up without having to focus on them too closely."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:79,columnNumber:5},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"As an example, when you look at a painting or drawing, you can see how the artist used lines to create depth and perspective in his work. The artist will start by drawing one line going from left to right and then continue by adding more lines until he achieves the desired effect of depth and perspective within his work of art."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:81,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"A shape is any closed area on a flat surface that encloses an area and has a boundary formed by straight lines (circles are closed areas). Shapes are built from lines, curves, and angles. They have volume and weight even though they do not have mass like solid objects do; this makes them ideal for representing objects in art because they can be easily manipulated without changing their appearance too much (e.g., you can make them smaller or larger without affecting their shape)."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/aliimam/Documents/designali/apps/web/src/content/designs/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-677b8bd3-ca81-43eb-a200-5726e12ba291.mdx",lineNumber:85,columnNumber:5},this),`
